newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber ends down on sluggish trade, Tokyo.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber ends down on sluggish trade, Tokyo.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices retained midday losses and ended lower after the market trudged through another sluggish day, unaided by weak futures in Tokyo.

At the close, the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board (MRELB) quoted market indicator price for November RSS 1 buyer at 309.50 cents ($1.24) a kg, one cent down from Monday. November SMR 20 buyer was unchanged at 306.
Traders offered the SMR 20 at 305-306 cents, SMR10 at 307, SMR 5 at 317, SMR L at 343, SMR CV at 363 and drum latex at 235.
"The sky's still wet....buyers and sellers are still cautious, nothing has changed," said a dealer.
Traders said the market was seeing yet another extended bearish period when buyers seemed adequately stocked after active short-covering in recent months.
Rains since early October have somehat reduced output from rubber plantations but sentiment and demand remained weak, said traders.
The INRO five-day average rose to 238.72 Malaysian/Singapore cents per kg on Oct 21 from 238.69 on Oct 18. The daily indicator was unchanged at 238.98.
